title: Mollys Castle
text:
Mollys Castle is a remote 5,265-foot (1,605-meter) elevation summit located near <a href="Goblin%20Valley%20State%20Park">Goblin Valley State Park</a>, in <a href="Emery%20County%2C%20Utah">Emery County, Utah</a>. Mollys Castle is situated east of <a href="Wild%20Horse%20Butte">Wild Horse Butte</a>, and one-half mile outside the park's east boundary. The top of this magnificent <a href="butte">butte</a> rises 265 feet above its surrounding terrain. Precipitation <a href="Surface%20runoff">runoff</a> from Mollys Castle enters the <a href="Colorado%20River">Colorado River</a> drainage basin.
Geology.
Mollys Castle is a geological feature set within the San Rafael Desert on the southeastern edge of the <a href="San%20Rafael%20Swell">San Rafael Swell</a>. This erosional remnant is composed of <a href="Jurassic">Jurassic</a> rock. The thin, light-colored layer on top is <a href="Curtis%20Formation">Curtis Formation</a> <a href="caprock">caprock</a>, overlaying darker, reddish <a href="Entrada%20Sandstone">Entrada Sandstone</a>, which is also the composition of the <a href="Hoodoo%20%28geology%29">hoodoos</a> that give Goblin Valley its name.
Climate.
Spring and fall are the most favorable seasons to visit Mollys Castle. According to the <a href="K%C3%B6ppen%20climate%20classification">Köppen climate classification</a> system, it is located in a <a href="Cold%20semi-arid%20climate">Cold semi-arid climate</a> zone, which is defined by the coldest month having an average mean temperature below −0 °C (32 °F) and at least 50% of the total annual precipitation being received during the spring and summer. This desert climate receives less than of annual rainfall, and snowfall is generally light during the winter.
